data.question: What is the chemical formula of MFM-136?
At what temperature were the CO2 adsorption isotherms for MFM-136 recorded?
What is the BET surface area of MFM-136?
Does MFM-136 have open metal sites?
data.answer: No, all Cu(II) sites are fully coordinated, leaving no open metal sites.

data.question: What method was used to determine the binding sites of CO2 in MFM-136?
What is the CO2 uptake of MFM-136 at 20 bar and 298 K?
Is the CO2 uptake of MFM-136 at 273 K higher than at 298 K?
What technique was used to study the vibrational modes of MFM-136?
What was the main finding from the neutron diffraction study regarding CO2 binding in MFM-136?
data.answer: There is no direct binding between adsorbed CO2 molecules and the pendant amide group in the pore.

data.question: Did the INS study show significant changes in the N-H motion upon CO2 loading in MFM-136?
data.answer: False, the N-H motion showed no detectable changes upon CO2 loading.

data.question: What was the purpose of using Grand Canonical Monte-Carlo (GCMC) simulations in the study of MFM-136?
data.answer: To simulate the adsorption of CO2 and N2 and predict the most populated regions for CO2 adsorption sites.

data.question: What is the role of amide groups in CO2 adsorption according to the study?
data.answer: The study suggests that the introduction of amide groups alone may not necessarily result in specific guest-host binding for CO2.

data.question: Was the structure of MFM-136 retained after desolvation?
data.answer: True, the PXRD data confirmed the phase purity and retention of the framework structure upon removal of the free solvents.

data.question: What was the highest CO2 uptake recorded for MFM-136 at 1 bar and 273 K?
What was the isosteric heat of adsorption for CO2 in MFM-136 at low surface coverage?
Does MFM-136 show higher selectivity for CO2 over CH4?
data.answer: True, MFM-136 shows selectivities for CO2/CH4 of 6.3:1 at 273 K.

data.question: What was the method used for synthesizing MFM-136?
What is the void fraction of MFM-136?
Was direct H2N-(δ-)···(δ+)­CO2 binding observed in MFM-136?
data.answer: False, the study found no direct binding between CO2 and the amide groups.

data.question: What was the BET surface area of MFM-136 compared to other amide-functionalized MOFs?
data.answer: MFM-136 has a BET surface area of 1634 m2 g-1, which is competitive with other amide-functionalized MOFs.
